s0001.literal: Former writings stated 'the barbarian leaders submitted,' the Poetry says 'Xu Fang has already come,' the Spring and Autumn Annals listed the rank of Lu Zi, permitting his admiration for the Central States.
s0001.idiomatic: Ancient texts spoke of barbarian leaders submitting themselves, the Book of Poetry mentions Xu Fang coming to join us, and the Spring and Autumn Annals recorded the noble rank of Duke Lu, acknowledging his longing for the culture of the Central Plains.

s0002.literal: From the Han founding until the time of Xiaowen, then there were the enfeoffments of Gong Gao and Xiangcheng, although they came from outside, they were originally descendants of meritorious officials.
s0002.idiomatic: From the founding of the Han dynasty until the reign of Emperor Xiaowen, there were the enfeoffments of Gong Gao and Xiangcheng. Though they came from foreign lands, they were descendants of the original meritorious officials.

s0003.literal: Therefore when Xiaojing first wanted to enfeoff those who surrendered, Chancellor Zhou Yafu adhered to the agreement and disputed it.
s0003.idiomatic: Therefore, when Emperor Xiaojing first wanted to grant noble titles to those who surrendered, Chancellor Zhou Yafu clung to the original agreement and argued against it.

s0004.literal: The emperor rejected his opinion, initially opened the regulations for enfeoffment and rewards, and moreover there was the matter of Wu and Chu.
s0004.idiomatic: The emperor dismissed his arguments and for the first time established regulations for granting titles and rewards. Moreover, there was the rebellion of Wu and Chu.

s0005.literal: Wu arose from the campaigns against Hu and Yue, generals and commanders received noble ranks, responding to the original agreement.
s0005.idiomatic: Emperor Wu's campaigns against the Xiongnu and Yue tribes led to generals and commanders receiving noble titles, fulfilling the original agreements.

s0006.literal: Later there was peace and stability, there were somewhat meritorious officials, I gathered and arranged them, continuing the order of the original meritorious officials.
s0006.idiomatic: Later, during times of peace and stability, there were officials who had rendered service. I have gathered and organized them here, continuing in the order of the original meritorious officials.

s22.literal: 以校尉擊胡，虜獲首虜千餘級，以將軍擊南越，定隴西，功侯。
s22.idiomatic: As a Colonel, he attacked the Xiongnu, capturing over a thousand heads. As a General, he attacked Nanyue, pacified Longxi, and for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s23.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s34.literal: 以輕車將軍擊匈奴，俘獲甚多，功侯。
s34.idiomatic: As General of Light Chariots, he attacked the Xiongnu, capturing many prisoners, and for these merits was granted the title of Marquis.

s35.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).

s44.literal: 以驍騎將軍出右北平，擊匈奴，獲隴西、安定、北地、上郡、河南之功，侯。
s44.idiomatic: As General of Valiant Cavalry, he went out from Youbeiping and attacked the Xiongnu, achieving merits in Longxi, Anding, Beidi, Shangjun, and Henan, and was granted the title of Marquis.

s45.idiomatic: Enfeoffed in the sixth year of Yuanshuo (123 BCE).
